intro: Galium firmum subsp. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and slender stems. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
